Comments_List: Vocabulary and grammar, as well as insights into Chinese culture
I learned language skills, grammar, vocabulary, and increased speaking skills.
Overall, throughout this course I further improved upon my Chinese Reading, Writing, Speaking, and Listening abilities.
Further developed my knowledge of chinese language and culture

This course taught me even more Chinese vocabulary/grammar structures, in a continuation of Chinese L1/L2. In addition to these, I gained more skill in writing short essays, which was not emphasized as much in L1/L2.
This course is certainly pedagogically much better than CHNS110 and CHNS120. I very much prefer having the same teacher during the entire semester instead of changing every week.
It is a course that, by nature of the language, is very based on memorization. I like the interactive aspect of the classes but would love even more opportunities to engage in dialogues.
The strengths are the close relationships with the teachers, tutorials, the presentations, and he teacher-class participation.

Overall, I think this course does a great job of improving students Chinese language abilities - the only thing I feel could be improved would be spending more time on sentence structures as opposed to the story for each section.
The teachers, Laoshi sun, was great and made class engaging and the learning fun. However, the class moves very fast and there is not a lot of time to properly learn all the vocab.

The regular structure of how each textbook chapter is covered over six days helped me a lot to focus on learning the new vocabulary/grammar structures. I also found the grammar feedback I got on my short essays super helpful.
Yes, absolutely. I think the course greatly improves your Chinese abilities.
Yes! The Proffesors are really good!

I would definitely recommend this class. The professors are amazing, brilliant, kind, and supportive. Plus you learn so much Chinese and just by nature of meeting everyday you will exponentially improve.
